input_text:
Job Title: Insurance Associate

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
The Insurance Associate is responsible for assisting the VP, Front End Insurance Compliance in the analysis of insurance information received from borrowers to proactively identify insurance deficiencies.  
Essential Job Functions (Duties/Responsibilities) 
The Insurance Associate will have the following duties and responsibilities, including but not limited to:
 Receive and collect insurance information from third parties (insurance agents/brokers)Ensure complete and accurate insurance information is sent to appropriate departments within the companyCommunicate and follow-up with insurance agents and Underwriting Analysts for additional information when neededRemain in contact with both internal clients and insurance agents/brokersInsurance file maintenance 
Qualifications  
Education: Bachelor’s degree; Insurance Broker’s License is preferred but not required. 
Experience: Minimum of 5 years’ experience working in the insurance industry, specifically property coverage knowledge 
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:  
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and WordPossess excellent organizational and multi-tasking skillsHard working, a quick learner, detail oriented and able to work in a fast paced environment 
Travel:  None 

Arbor Realty Trust, Inc. offers a competitive base salary and discretionary bonus. The starting base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $85,000. The specific compensation that will be offered is based on an understanding of the hired candidates' qualifications at the time of hire. Employees are eligible for a discretionary bonus based on employee work performance reviewed during the course of the year. The total compensation package for this position will also include other elements, a full range of medical, and/or other benefits including 401(k) eligibility and paid time off benefits.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to maintaining a diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment for our associates, customers and business partners. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, ethnicity, pregnancy or any other legally protected status. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Insurance Associate
output_json.summary: Assists in analyzing insurance information received from borrowers to identify insurance deficiencies.
job_responsibilities: Receive and collect insurance information from third parties
Ensure complete and accurate insurance information is sent to appropriate departments
Communicate and follow-up with insurance agents and Underwriting Analysts
Maintain contact with internal clients and insurance agents/brokers
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.
